issue.title: Our NPM page has over 10 broken links an images
issue.body:
![Screenshot_20220928-211552](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/876076/192776823-1897f495-5998-4a3e-b083-6c9b43572bb5.png)

Our NPM page possibly the highest traffic, highest ranked, most consequential FeathersJs front page

...and yet it links to a broken image of a broken slack channel, has a date of 2019, and about 3 broken donation buttons...

comment.body: Thanks! I'll have to see when to cut this into a new release since v5 should become latest shortly but you are making a good point that the current one should be up to date.

comment.body:
With the new `@feathersjs/knex` you can get a reference to to the table by calling `service.db([params])`:

```js
app.service('orders').db().select('finished')
```

issue.title: getGrantConfig being hard-coded to use http on local dev not ideal for some setups
issue.body:
We recently did a long-overdue dependency update, with one of those updates being a conversion from pre.10 versions of Feathers packages to pre.29. I noticed that in local dev, our oauth logins weren't working any more. I see in the new getGrantConfig in authentication-oauth/src/utils.ts  that, if NODE_ENV is 'development', it's hard-coding the protocol to be 'http' and adding a non-'80' port onto the host. We use https when running locally and were already adding the port onto the host in order to work in prior versions. The latter isn't too much of an issue to change, but the former is more of a problem, since we're not going to switch to http.

I don't think assuming that everyone runs http locally is a good assumption, as we can't be the only people who use https in order to more closely mirror production (and prevent warnings/issues with mixed fetching of http and https resources). 

I can get around this by setting NODE_ENV to production locally, and as it turns out we don't seem to be running any important logic off of NODE_ENV so this shouldn't mess up our local dev process, but I don't think NODE_ENV !== 'production' should be forcing http. There may very well be others who are using NODE_ENV to set other logic, which would force them to either not be able to easily test OAuth locally, have to switch to http (which may be impractical), or change that other logic to be conditional on something else.

### Expected behavior
http vs. https for origin urls on local dev (NODE_ENV !== 'production') should be configurable

### Actual behavior
local dev forces http on origin urls

issue.title: Support for feathers v5 (Dove)
issue.body:
I might be building a new feathers app soon and since dove (v5) is around the corner, i've tried using the current pre-31 version of it. So far all almost all our requirements are fulfilled, except for swagger/openapi integration which is not yet v5 compatible. 

Is there a timeline for supporting it?
I have tried the `custom-methods-v5` branch and could get it to work by installing the `koa-mount` dependency. But it does not automatically generate the exposed services in the swagger.json. Manually settings `docs` on properties also fails. 

Do you know how to get it working or is this something you have not looked into yet? If there is a (manual) way, i would be interested. Thanks.

comment.body: Could we add schema (and other OpenApi) information with the [new service options](https://dove.feathersjs.com/api/application.html#use-path-service-options) and auto generate things from that?

issue.title: App not running from feathersjs\cli@5.0.0-pre.31 : feathers generate app command
issue.body:
start script is node lib.
feathers is not creating lib

```feathers generate app
? Do you want to use JavaScript or TypeScript? TypeScript
? What is the name of your application? dove_test
? Write a short description
? Which HTTP framework do you want to use? Express
? What APIs do you want to offer? HTTP (REST), Real-time
? Which package manager are you using? npm
? Which database are you connecting to? Other databases can be added at any time MongoDB
? Enter your database connection string mongodb://localhost:27017/dove_test
? Which authentication methods do you want to use? Other methods and providers can be added at any time. Email + Password
```

### Expected behavior
Should start app

### Actual behavior
error : Cannot find module {project_path}\lib

### System configuration

**feathers Version**: ^5.0.0-pre.31

comment.body: This has been changed to allow for proper production deploys. For a TypeScript app you have to run `npm run compile` before starting it or use the development mode with `npm run dev`.

issue.title: Service middleware custom property not working
issue.body:
In the newest release v5.0.0-pre.30, when I follow the below snippet (from the official FeathersJS documentation) on how to set properties on the service method params, it wouldn't actually show up in the service's params.

```js
app.configure(rest())
  .use(json())
  .use(urlencoded({ extended: true }))
  .use(function (req, res, next) {
    req.feathers.fromMiddleware = 'Hello world'
    next()
  })
```

comment.body:
This is indeed something that changed in v5 in that `app.configure(rest())` now has to happen __after__ any other middleware. This is why we now get much faster routing (than built-in Express) and service unregistration at runtime.

This should work which I will update in the docs as well:

```js
app
  .use(json())
  .use(urlencoded({ extended: true }))
  .use(function (req, res, next) {
    req.feathers.fromMiddleware = 'Hello world'
    next()
  })
  .configure(rest())
```

pull_request.title: fix(transports): Add remaining middleware for generated apps to Koa and Express
pull_request.body: Since we already pulled in other middleware we can add the remaining middleware packages as direct dependencies to `@feathersjs/koa` and `@feathersjs/express`.

commits.message: feat(cli): Generate full client test suite and improve typed client (#2788)

issue.title: Typescript error rest client custom method

pull_request.title: feat(cli): Generate full client test suite and improve typed client
pull_request.body:
This pull request adds a test suite for the typed client to the generated application and moves the authentication tests into the client test suite. This helps to ensure that the typed client is fully functional and makes it easy to create full integration tests for an app. It also improves the typed client to dynamically import the actual service signature instead of using a generic interface.

Should close https://github.com/feathersjs/feathers/issues/2775

It also ensures that a standard app can be restarted. Previously, routes got removed on `teardown` instead of `unuse` which cause services to be no longer discoverable when the app is restarted (via `.teardown()` and then calling `.setup()`) again. The authentication service was also initialising its hooks twice in that case.

issue.body:
We recently did a long-overdue dependency update, with one of those updates being a conversion from pre.10 versions of Feathers packages to pre.29. I noticed that in local dev, our oauth logins weren't working any more. I see in the new getGrantConfig in authentication-oauth/src/utils.ts  that, if NODE_ENV is 'development', it's hard-coding the protocol to be 'http' and adding a non-'80' port onto the host. We use https when running locally and were already adding the port onto the host in order to work in prior versions. The latter isn't too much of an issue to change, but the former is more of a problem, since we're not going to switch to http.

I don't think assuming that everyone runs http locally is a good assumption, as we can't be the only people who use https in order to more closely mirror production (and prevent warnings/issues with mixed fetching of http and https resources). 

I can get around this by setting NODE_ENV to production locally, and as it turns out we don't seem to be running any important logic off of NODE_ENV so this shouldn't mess up our local dev process, but I don't think NODE_ENV !== 'production' should be forcing http. There may very well be others who are using NODE_ENV to set other logic, which would force them to either not be able to easily test OAuth locally, have to switch to http (which may be impractical), or change that other logic to be conditional on something else.

### Expected behavior
http vs. https for origin urls on local dev (NODE_ENV !== 'production') should be configurable

### Actual behavior
local dev forces http on origin urls

issue.title: [dove][package error] Creating an error with a null err breaks
issue.body:
I'm migrating the `feathers-authentication-management` package to dove, and I encounter an error in the... `error` package :-).

We have a call to `BadRequest` with potentially no error message in first param (see https://github.com/feathersjs-ecosystem/feathers-authentication-management/blob/master/src/methods/check-unique.ts#L74-L77).

In [crow implementation](https://github.com/feathersjs/feathers/blob/crow/packages/errors/lib/index.js), if we make the call

```ts
const err = new BadRequest(null, data)
// this will equivalent to
const err = FeathersError(null, 'BadRequest', 400, 'bad-request', data);
```
`err` will be like 
```js
{
  type: 'FeathersError',
  name: 'BadRequest',
  message: 'Error', // by default, with null value in first param, the "Error" string is set
  code: 400,
  className: 'bad-request', 
  ...
}
```

In [dove implementation](https://github.com/feathersjs/feathers/blob/dove/packages/errors/src/index.ts#L25), with the same call - the `BadRequest` one,
this will break at [#L35](https://github.com/feathersjs/feathers/blob/dove/packages/errors/src/index.ts#L35) as `typeof null === 'object'` is `true`.
Code will try to destructure `null` in `{ message, errors, ...rest }`.

Another interesting thing is that constructor of errors like, eg, [`BadRequest`](https://github.com/feathersjs/feathers/blob/dove/packages/errors/src/index.ts#L68) takes 2 optional params `message?: ErrorMessage, data?: any`, but the [`FeathersError` constructor](https://github.com/feathersjs/feathers/blob/dove/packages/errors/src/index.ts#L24) want mandatory params : `err` and `_data` aren't optional.
This use case allow `feathers-authentication-management` to still create `BadRequest` errors with an `err` `null`.

Is this use case still accepted ?
Could we fix the previous implementation ?
I fix temporary the package by updating the [#L36](https://github.com/feathersjs/feathers/blob/dove/packages/errors/src/index.ts#L36) : 

```js
  const { message, errors, ...rest } = typeof err === 'object' && err !== null ? err : _data;
```

If needed, I can submit a PR with fix on typing (FeathersError constructor with `err: ErrorMessage | null`) and tests proving `new BadRequest(null, ...)` work.

comment.body: Thanks for the detailed error report. This should be fixed via #2776 2794

commits.message: fix(errors): Allows to pass no error message (#2794)

issue.title: [dove][package error] Creating an error with a null err breaks
issue.body:
I'm migrating the `feathers-authentication-management` package to dove, and I encounter an error in the... `error` package :-).

We have a call to `BadRequest` with potentially no error message in first param (see https://github.com/feathersjs-ecosystem/feathers-authentication-management/blob/master/src/methods/check-unique.ts#L74-L77).

In [crow implementation](https://github.com/feathersjs/feathers/blob/crow/packages/errors/lib/index.js), if we make the call

```ts
const err = new BadRequest(null, data)
// this will equivalent to
const err = FeathersError(null, 'BadRequest', 400, 'bad-request', data);
```
`err` will be like 
```js
{
  type: 'FeathersError',
  name: 'BadRequest',
  message: 'Error', // by default, with null value in first param, the "Error" string is set
  code: 400,
  className: 'bad-request', 
  ...
}
```

In [dove implementation](https://github.com/feathersjs/feathers/blob/dove/packages/errors/src/index.ts#L25), with the same call - the `BadRequest` one,
this will break at [#L35](https://github.com/feathersjs/feathers/blob/dove/packages/errors/src/index.ts#L35) as `typeof null === 'object'` is `true`.
Code will try to destructure `null` in `{ message, errors, ...rest }`.

Another interesting thing is that constructor of errors like, eg, [`BadRequest`](https://github.com/feathersjs/feathers/blob/dove/packages/errors/src/index.ts#L68) takes 2 optional params `message?: ErrorMessage, data?: any`, but the [`FeathersError` constructor](https://github.com/feathersjs/feathers/blob/dove/packages/errors/src/index.ts#L24) want mandatory params : `err` and `_data` aren't optional.
This use case allow `feathers-authentication-management` to still create `BadRequest` errors with an `err` `null`.

Is this use case still accepted ?
Could we fix the previous implementation ?
I fix temporary the package by updating the [#L36](https://github.com/feathersjs/feathers/blob/dove/packages/errors/src/index.ts#L36) : 

```js
  const { message, errors, ...rest } = typeof err === 'object' && err !== null ? err : _data;
```

If needed, I can submit a PR with fix on typing (FeathersError constructor with `err: ErrorMessage | null`) and tests proving `new BadRequest(null, ...)` work.

issue.title: Koa errorHandler should not fail with non number error.code
issue.body:
https://github.com/feathersjs/feathers/blob/d886f333ace3dde1f5ca52e3569346dfd22e9d20/packages/koa/src/handlers.ts#L12

When an error with a code that is not a number is thrown and caught here, the following error appears

```
  AssertionError [ERR_ASSERTION]: status code must be a number
      at Object.set status [as status] (\projectname\node_modules\koa\lib\response.js:86:5)
      at \projectname\node_modules\@feathersjs\koa\src\handlers.ts:12:24
      at async serve (\projectname\node_modules\koa-static\index.js:53:9)
      at async cors (\projectname\node_modules\@koa\cors\index.js:108:16)
```

It should be checked if the error.code is a number (or a valid status code) before using it.

issue.title: feathers dove: default is ignored for
issue.body:
### Steps to reproduce
Create a Schema with a nested object property for any class.
Give default: (any value) inside properties of that nested object (type) like below:

```td
export const courseDataSchema = schema({
    $id: 'CourseData',
    type: 'object',
    additionalProperties: false,
    required: ['account', 'has_certificate'], //
    properties: {
      title: { type: 'string' },
      nested_obj: {
        name: { type: 'string' },
        status: { type: 'string', default: 'active'},
      }
  }
});
```

### Expected behavior
This should work without any error.
### Actual behavior
Error: strict mode: default is ignored for: data16.status

**Feathersjs version**: "^5.0.0-pre.29"

**NodeJS version**: "16.17.0"

**Operating System**: 

**Browser Version**:

**React Native Version**:

**Module Loader**:

pull_request.title: Update events.md
pull_request.body:
### Summary

(If you have not already please refer to the contributing guideline as [described
here](https://github.com/feathersjs/feathers/blob/crow/.github/contributing.md#pull-requests))

- [ ] Tell us about the problem your pull request is solving.
- [ ] Are there any open issues that are related to this?
- [ ] Is this PR dependent on PRs in other repos?

If so, please mention them to keep the conversations linked together.

### Other Information

If there's anything else that's important and relevant to your pull
request, mention that information here. This could include
benchmarks, or other information.

Your PR will be reviewed by a core team member and they will work with you to get your changes merged in a timely manner. If merged your PR will automatically be added to the changelog in the next release.

If your changes involve documentation updates please mention that and link the appropriate PR in [feathers-docs](https://github.com/feathersjs/feathers-docs).

Thanks for contributing to Feathers! :heart:

### Steps to reproduce

commits.message: Make client service types more dynamic

issue.title: Typescript error rest client custom method

comment.body:
I was wondering if we could re-use the `methods` array from the server side service registration but I'm concerned that - unlike `import type` which will always get removed at compile time - we might accidentally end up with server code in the client build. Let's try it with the above approach for now and see if there is a way to iterate.

Thank you for your help in testing this out!

issue.title: Typescript error rest client custom method

comment.body:
Unfortunately not. The reason is that we need an actual array for the methods to initialise them dynamically on the client services. This is not possible with only types.

I still think it's nicer than the previous `ClientService` interface where you have to define everything manually and get no help with refactoring at all - it would just break at runtime if you e.g. declare a custom method that doesn't exist on the server. Where in the above case you'd get a compilation error if e.g. a method is listed that doesn't exist on the service.

issue.title: Typescript error rest client custom method
Typescript error rest client custom method

comment.body:
I'm actually wondering if for custom methods to keep them in sync with the actual signatures we should do something like

```ts
import type { MessageService } from './services/messages/messages'

export interface ServiceTypes {
  messages: ClientService<
    Message,
    MessageData,
    Partial<MessageData>,
    Paginated<Message>,
    Params<MessageQuery>
  > & Pick<MessageService, 'customMethod'>
}
```

issue.title: Typescript error rest client custom method

pull_request.title: feat(cli): Generate full client test suite and make app restartable
pull_request.body:
This pull request adds a test suite for the typed client to the generated application and moves the authentication tests into the client test suite. This helps to ensure that the typed client is fully functional and makes it easy to create full integration tests for an app. Should close https://github.com/feathersjs/feathers/issues/2775

It also ensures that a standard app can be restarted. Previously, routes got removed on `teardown` instead of `unuse` which cause services to be no longer discoverable when the app is restarted (via `.teardown()` and then calling `.setup()`) again. The authentication service was also initialising its hooks twice in that case.

issue.title: dove: missing dependency `@sinclair/typebox` in `@feathersjs/schema`
issue.body:
This is a problem which @mdartic encountered here: https://github.com/feathersjs-ecosystem/feathers-authentication-management/pull/196#discussion_r990638194

`@sinclair/typebox` is imported here: https://github.com/feathersjs/feathers/blob/dove/packages/schema/src/json-schema.ts#L3
But not listed in dependencies here: https://github.com/feathersjs/feathers/blob/dove/packages/schema/package.json

comment.body: Should be fixed in the next prerelease :)
